description:
**Fix Overview**:

To mitigate the secure boot security feature bypass vulnerability (CVE-2024-37981), it is recommended to apply the necessary updates provided by Microsoft. Follow these steps:

1. Identify your Windows version and corresponding build number.
2. Download the appropriate update package from the Microsoft Update Catalog based on your system version:
   - For Windows 11 Version 23H2 for x64-based Systems, use KB5040442: [Download KB5040442](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5040442).
   - For Windows 11 Version 22H2 for x64-based Systems, also use KB5040442: [Download KB5040442](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5040442).
   - For Windows 11 Version 21H2 for x64-based Systems, use KB5040431: [Download KB5040431](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5040431).
   - For Windows 10 Version 22H2 for x64-based Systems, use KB5040427: [Download KB5040427](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5040427).
   - For Windows 10 Version 21H2 for x64-based Systems, also use KB5040427: [Download KB5040427](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5040427).

**Details**:
Each update addresses potential integer underflow issues that could enable an attacker to bypass security features. Ensure to restart your system after installation to apply changes effectively.

**Preconditions**:
- Identify and backup critical data before applying any updates.
- Ensure administrative access when initiating updates.
